images.summary: This site plan shows the overall layout of the property, including existing and proposed structures. The property is bordered by a 'PROPERTY LINE' and includes areas labeled as 'EXISTING BUSH' and 'EXISTING FIELD'. Key structures include an 'EXISTING BARN (TO REMAIN)', a 'PROPOSED 50'-0" x 90'-0" STORAGE SHED', an 'EXISTING DWELLING (TO REMAIN)', and an 'EXISTING RIDING ARENA (TO REMAIN)'. Dimensions such as '165'-0"', '721'-6 7/8"', '130'-0"', and '300'-0"' indicate distances between structures and property boundaries. The plan is drawn at a scale of '1" = 400'-0"'.

images.text_verbatim:
PRE-ENGINEERED TRUSSES @ SPACING PER PLAN (DESIGNED BY OTHERS) SUBMIT P.ENG. STAMPED SHOP DRAWINGS FOR REVIEW. (TYP. U.N.O.)
ALIGN TRUSSES w/ STUD BELOW (TYP. U.N.O.)
WOOD STUD WALL. SEE PLAN.
UPLIFT CLIPS TO BE PROVIDED PER TRUSS MANUFACTURER / ENGINEER DESIGN.
TOE NAIL TRUSSES TO TOP PLATE w/ (4) 3" NAILS PER TRUSS IN ADDITION TO UPLIFT CLIPS (TYP. U.N.O.)
2x4 STRUT x 5'-0" LONG @ TOP & BOTTOM WITH (2) 3-1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS WEB MEMBER
2x4 DIAGONAL "X" BRACE ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF TRUSS AT ENDWALLS & WHERE SPECIFIED ELSEWHERE
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL "X" ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF WEB WITH (4) 3-1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS
ROOF TRUSS BRACING NOTES
1. CONTRACTOR AND/OR OWNER TO NOTIFY MANUFACTURER OF ANY TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSSES, WARPING OF TRUSS MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2. DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS NOTED ON THE ATTACHED DRAWING(S). X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED AT ENDWALL AND AT INTERVALS NOTED ON THE ROOF PLAN.
3. PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS INDICATED ON THE ROOF PLAN AND MANUFACTURER'S DRAWINGS.
4. PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING AT ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN LATERAL BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
5. TRUSS SUPPLIER WILL DESIGN TRUSSES FOR BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
images.summary: This image contains notes and details related to roof truss bracing for the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed project. Key components include 'PRE-ENGINEERED TRUSSES', 'WOOD STUD WALL', 'UPLIFT CLIPS', and '2x4 DIAGONAL "X" BRACE'. The notes specify that trusses should be aligned with studs below and uplift clips provided per manufacturer/engineer design. Trusses are to be toe-nailed to the top plate with specified nails. The 'ROOF TRUSS BRACING NOTES' outline requirements for notifying manufacturers of truss deficiencies, providing diagonal bracing on web members, and ensuring permanent lateral bracing as indicated on plans. The contractor and truss supplier have specific responsibilities for designing and implementing bracing details.

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES:
1. 2x6 BRACE IS TO BE CONTINUOUS AND END @ STUD CONNECTION TO PLATE.
2. DO NOT NOTCH BRACES INTO STUDS.
3. INSTALL BRACES AT APPROXIMATELY 45 deg. ANGLES.
4. MINIMUM NAIL SPACING OF 1-1/4".
(3)-PLY SOLID BLOCKING BETWEEN STUDS FASTEN w/ (6) 3-1/2" NAILS THROUGH FACE & (3) NAILS THROUGH STUD INTO EACH END OF EACH BLOCK.
(2) 3-1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS INTO EACH STUD. (TYP.)
(12) 3-1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS EACH BRACE. (TOP & BOTTOM OF WALL).
(2) 1/2"dia. x6" lg. WEDGE ANCHOR @ EACH BRACE LOCATION. (TYP.)

images.summary: This section view illustrates the bracing connection details for the foundation wall of the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed. The detail includes '2x6 DIAGONAL BRACE', '3-PLY SOLID BLOCKING', and 'COMMON SPIRAL NAILS'. The notes specify that the '2x6 BRACE IS TO BE CONTINUOUS AND END @ STUD CONNECTION TO PLATE', with braces installed at approximately 45-degree angles. The bracing is secured with '3-1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS' and '1/2"dia. x6" lg. WEDGE ANCHOR' at each brace location. The section callout '2/S1.0' indicates the reference to this detail on sheet S1.0. The drawing scale is '1/2" = 1'-0"'.

images.summary: This section view details the foundation wall construction for the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed. Key components include a 'P.T. SILL PLATE', '8" CONCRETE FOUNDATION WALL', '15M VERTICALS', '15M HORIZONTALS', and a '24" x8" CONT. CONCRETE STRIP FOOTING'. The foundation wall is reinforced with '15M VERTICALS @ 48" o.c.' and horizontal bars at the top and grade. The 'P.T. SILL PLATE' is anchored with '1/2"dia. ANCHOR BOLTS @ 48" o.c.'. The foundation is designed to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill as approved by a geotechnical engineer. The section callout '1/S1.0' references this detail on sheet S1.0, with a drawing scale of '1/2" = 1'-0"'.

images.text_verbatim:
SHEARWALL (AS INDICATED):
• 1/2" PLYWOOD ON ONE SIDE FASTENED w/ 2-3/8" NAIL-GUN NAILS @ 4" o.c. PANEL EDGES & 12" o.c. IN FIELD. PROVIDE BLOCKING AT 24" o.c. AND ALL PANEL EDGES. PROVIDE (3)-PLY STUD POST EACH END OF SHEARWALL. (TYP. U.N.O.) SEE TYPICAL DETAIL.
ASSEMBLY SCHEDULE
F1 SLAB ON GRADE CONSTRUCTION:
• FLOOR FINISH (PER OWNER)
• 6" CONCRETE FLOOR SLAB
• 6" COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A' FILL
F2 SLAB ON GRADE CONSTRUCTION:
• FLOOR FINISH (BY OWNER)
• 6" CONCRETE FLOOR SLAB
• 6 mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
• 2" EXTRUDED POLYSTYRENE INSULATION (R10 MIN.)
• 6" COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A' FILL
WE1 EXTERIOR WALL CONSTRUCTION:
• 29 Ga. PREFIN. METAL CLADDING
• TYPAR AIR BARRIER, JOINTS TAPED
• 2x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• 2x6 WOOD STUDS @ 24" o.c.
WE2 EXTERIOR WALL CONSTRUCTION:
• 29 Ga. PREFIN. METAL CLADDING
• TYPAR AIR BARRIER, JOINTS TAPED
• 2x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• 2x6 WOOD STUDS @ 24" o.c.
• w/ ROCKWOOL BATT INSULATION (R22 MIN.)
• 6mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
• 1/2" PLYWOOD SHEATHING
R1 ROOF CONSTRUCTION:
• 29 Ga. STEEL ROOFING
• 2x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• ROOF FRAMING AS PER PLANS
R2 ROOF CONSTRUCTION:
• 29 Ga. STEEL ROOFING
• 2x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• ROOF FRAMING AS PER PLANS w/ BLOWN-IN-PLACE INSULATION (R40, COORD. w/ OWNER)
• 6 mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER (IF INSUL.)
• 1x4 WOOD STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• INT'R LINER (PER OWNER)
P1 INTERIOR PARTITION:
• 1/2" PLYWOOD
• 2x6 STUDS @ 16" o.c.
• w/ ROCKWOOL BATT INSULATION (R22 MIN.)
• 1/2" PLYWOOD
NOTE:
PROVIDE SOLID BLOCKING @ 48" o.c. IN ALL WALLS TALLER THAN 9'-6".
images.summary: This image presents an assembly schedule detailing various construction components for the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed. The schedule includes specifications for shearwalls, slab on grade construction, exterior wall construction, roof construction, and interior partitions. Shearwalls are specified with 1/2" plywood fastened with nails and require blocking and stud posts. Slab on grade construction is detailed for two types (F1 and F2), with concrete floor slabs and granular fill, and F2 includes additional insulation and vapor barriers. Exterior walls (WE1 and WE2) feature metal cladding, air barriers, and wood studs, with WE2 including insulation and sheathing. Roof construction (R1 and R2) involves steel roofing, strapping, and framing, with R2 having additional insulation and vapor barriers. Interior partitions (P1) are constructed with plywood and insulated wood studs. The note specifies solid blocking for taller walls.

This ground floor plan for the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed shows the layout of walls, doors, and lintels. The plan includes dimensions for various sections, such as 5'-0", 16'-0", and 12'-0", indicating the spacing and size of structural elements. Lintel marks L1, L2, L3, and L4 are shown, along with wall types WE1 and WE2, and partition P1. Door dimensions are specified as 48" x 36"H and 36" x 80"H. The plan is drawn at a scale of 1/8" = 1'-0". A section callout 2/S2.0 indicates a related section view on another sheet.

images.summary: This foundation plan for the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed illustrates the layout of concrete walls and footings. Dimensions such as 9'-10 1/2", 16'-3", and 39'-0" provide detailed measurements for the foundation layout. Rebar is specified as (4) 15M verticals between openings, typical for all sections. The plan includes element callouts F1 and F2 for slab types, and CWB for concrete wall blocks. A note indicates drop walls at door locations to 6" below the finished floor. A section callout 1/S1.0 refers to a related section view.

MARK SIZE BEARING
L1 (2)-2x6 (1) JACK + (1) KING
L2 (2)-2x10 (1) JACK + (1) KING
L3 (2)-1.75" x 14" LVL 2.0E 3100fb (2) JACK + (2) KING

images.summary: This lintel schedule provides specifications for lintels used in the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed. It lists four lintel types: L1, L2, L3, and L4. L1 consists of (2)-2x6 with (1) jack and (1) king stud. L2 uses (2)-2x10 with the same bearing configuration. L3 is made of (2)-1.75" x 14" LVL 2.0E 3100fb with (2) jack and (2) king studs. L4 offers two options: (3) 1.75" x 14" 2.0E 3100fb or W10x22, with (3) jack and (2) king studs. These specifications ensure proper support and load distribution across openings.

images.summary: This section view of the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed illustrates the structural relationship between the roof and walls. The section is identified as 2/S2.0 and shows insulated building components. Continuous 2x6 X-bracing is specified for trusses, with lateral bracing as per manufacturer’s specifications. Ridge venting and truss uplift clips are detailed, along with a double top plate. The section includes a P.T. sill plate with anchor bolts at 48" o.c. Concrete foundations are shown, bearing on undisturbed soil or compacted fill. Wall assemblies include WE2 and F2, with foam eave vents and metal fascia. The section provides a comprehensive view of the construction details, ensuring structural integrity and compliance with design specifications.

images.summary: This section view illustrates a building section of the roof, showing the relationship between the roof trusses and the walls. The section is labeled as '1/S2.0' and is a transverse section through the building. Key components include continuous 2x6 X-bracing fastened to the top side of the bottom chord of the trusses, prefinished metal fascia, eavestrough, and vented soffit. The trusses are not shown in detail, and stamped shop drawings are required for review. The section specifies the use of truss uplift clips and double top plates. The concrete foundations are to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill, as approved by a geotechnical engineer. The section also details the use of P.T. sill plates with sill gaskets and anchor bolts. The section is not insulated, as noted in the drawing.

images.summary: This detail provides an elevation and section view of a shearwall, labeled as '3/S2.0'. The shearwall is constructed with plywood fastened per the wall schedule using 2-3/8" nailgun nails at specified intervals. Solid blocking is provided at 24" on center and at all panel edges. The detail includes a 3-ply stud post at each end of the shearwall, secured with L5x3x1/4" angle and a 5/8" diameter hooked anchor into the concrete foundation wall. The 3-ply post is further secured to the angle with wood lag screws. This detail highlights the connection between the shearwall and the foundation, emphasizing the structural integrity required for lateral loads.

images.text_verbatim:
ROOF TRUSS FRAMING PLAN
1" = 10'-0"
PRE-ENG. WOOD ROOF TRUSSES (ALIGN DIRECTLY ABOVE STUDS). INSTALL BRACING ON ALL TRUSSES AS PER DESIGN BY ENGINEER. LATERAL BRACING TO BE SHOWN ON TRUSS SHOP DRAWINGS.
CONTINUOUS 2x6 BRACING FASTENED DIRECTLY TO TOP SIDE OF TRUSS BOTTOM CHORD. (TYP.)
FASTEN GABLE END TRUSS TO TOP PLATE w/ 3-1/2" NAILS @ 10" o.c. OR FASTEN GABLE END TRUSS TO EACH THROUGH STUD w/ (3) 3-1/2" NAILS. (TYP. BOTH GABLE ENDS)
images.summary: This plan view shows the roof truss framing layout for the Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed. It details the arrangement of pre-engineered wood roof trusses, which are aligned directly above the studs. Continuous 2x6 bracing is fastened directly to the top side of the truss bottom chord. The plan specifies fastening methods for the gable end truss, either to the top plate with nails at 10 inches on center or through each stud with three 3-1/2 inch nails. This framing plan ensures the structural stability of the roof system and provides guidance for the installation of trusses and bracing.
